001package org.biopax.paxtools.util;
002
003import org.biopax.paxtools.model.BioPAXElement;
004import org.slf4j.Logger;
005import org.slf4j.LoggerFactory;
006
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.HashSet;
009import java.util.Map;
010import java.util.Set;
011
012
013public enum BPCollections
014{
015        I;
016
017        private CollectionProvider cProvider;
018
019        private final Logger log = LoggerFactory.getLogger(BPCollections.class);
020
021        BPCollections()
022        {
023                String prop = System.getProperty("paxtools.CollectionProvider");
024                log.info("System property: paxtools.CollectionProvider=" + prop);               
025                if (prop != null)
026                {
027                        try
028                        {
029                                Class<? extends CollectionProvider> cProviderClass =
030                                                (Class<? extends CollectionProvider>) Class.forName(prop);
031                                cProvider = cProviderClass.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
032                                log.info("CollectionProvider " + prop + " was successfully activated.");
033                        }
034                        catch (Exception e) // catch (IllegalAccessException | ClassNotFoundException | InstantiationException e)
035                        {
036                                log.warn("Could not initialize the specified collector provider:" + prop +
037                                         " . Falling back to default " +
038                                         "Hash based implementation. Underlying exception is " + e);
039
040                        }
041                }
042
043                if (cProvider == null) {
044                        cProvider = new CollectionProvider() {
045                                @Override
046                                public <R> Set<R> createSet() {
047                                        return new HashSet<R>();
048                                }
049
050                                @Override
051                                public <D, R> Map<D, R> createMap() {
052                                        return new HashMap<D, R>();
053                                }
054                        };
055                        log.info("Using the default CollectionProvider (creates HashMap, HashSet).");
056                }
057                
058        }
059
060        /**
061         * This interface is responsible for setting the class 
062         * and initialize and load factor for all sets and maps 
063         * used in all model objects for performance purposes.
064         */
065        public interface CollectionProvider
066        {
067                <R> Set<R> createSet();
068
069                <D, R> Map<D, R> createMap();
070        }
071
072        /**
073         * Sets a specific {@link CollectionProvider} (for 
074         * multiple-cardinality BioPAX properties)
075         * 
076         * @param newProvider not null
077         */
078        public void setProvider(CollectionProvider newProvider)
079        {
080                if(newProvider == null)
081                        throw new IllegalArgumentException();
082                
083                cProvider = newProvider;
084                
085                log.info("Using CollectionProvider: " 
086                                + newProvider.getClass().getSimpleName());
087        }
088
089        public <R> Set<R> createSet()
090        {
091                return cProvider.createSet();
092        }
093
094        public <R extends BioPAXElement> Set<R> createSafeSet()
095        {
096                return new BiopaxSafeSet<R>();
097        }
098
099        public <D, R> Map<D, R> createMap()
100        {
101                return cProvider.createMap();
102        }
103}
